snippet: Gov. Mark Dayton pledged to veto an education funding bill, saying that the increase in school spending was not enough to serve the needs of Minnesota children.
abstract: Minnesota Gov Mark Dayton says he will veto education funding bill because $400 million increase in state spending is inadequate; Dayton, a Democrat, had wanted universal prekindergarten funding to be included in bill, and blames Republicans in Legislature for failure to reach compromise.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Mark Dayton pledged to veto an education funding bill, saying that the increase in school spending was not enough to serve the needs of Minnesota children.

headline.main: A Vow to Veto a Schools Bill in Minnesota
headline.print_headline: A Vow to Veto a Schools Bill in Minnesota
